content.raw:
I noticed that [INTEGRATION_gpu_laser failed on xenial-nvidia](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/337/testReport/(root)/INTEGRATION_gpu_laser/test_ran/) with the following console output:

~~~
453: [ RUN      ] GPURaySensorTest.LaserUnitBox
453: [Msg] Waiting for master.
453: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
453: [Msg] Publicized address: 172.17.0.5
453: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:207] ServerFixture load in 0.9 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
453: [Wrn] [msgs.cc:1808] Conversion of sensor type[gpu_ray] not suppported.
453: [Wrn] [msgs.cc:1808] Conversion of sensor type[gpu_ray] not suppported.
453: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:133] ServerFixture::Unload
453: [       OK ] GPURaySensorTest.LaserUnitBox (2447 ms)
453: [ RUN      ] GPURaySensorTest.NameCollision
157/200 Test #453: INTEGRATION_gpu_laser .................................***Exception: SegFault  2.73 sec
~~~

I'm able to reproduce it maybe 50% of the time. The backtrace implicates the following line in [Console.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/4ec26fcd89872290714029c0126dd837302ac9f6/gazebo/common/Console.cc?at=gazebo7&fileviewer=file-view-default#Console.cc-205) of all places:

~~~
buf->stream = new std::ofstream(logPath.string().c_str(), std::ios::out);
~~~

~~~
Core was generated by `test/integration/INTEGRATION_gpu_laser'.
Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
#0  0x00007f14ccd59545 in _int_malloc (av=av@entry=0x7f14cd09bb20 <main_arena>, bytes=bytes@entry=8192) at malloc.c:3727
3727	malloc.c: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007f14ccd59545 in _int_malloc (av=av@entry=0x7f14cd09bb20 <main_arena>, bytes=bytes@entry=8192) at malloc.c:3727
#1  0x00007f14ccd5b184 in __GI___libc_malloc (bytes=8192) at malloc.c:2913
#2  0x00007f14cd64de78 in operator new(unsigned long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#3  0x00007f14cd64df19 in operator new[](unsigned long) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#4  0x00007f14cd6ac468 in std::basic_filebuf<char, std::char_traits<char> >::_M_allocate_internal_buffer() () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#5  0x00007f14cd6b06b2 in std::basic_filebuf<char, std::char_traits<char> >::open(char const*, std::_Ios_Openmode) () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#6  0x00007f14ce81bb1e in std::basic_ofstream<char, std::char_traits<char> >::open (__mode=std::_S_out, __s=0x223c220 "/home/scpeters/.gazebo/test-11345/test.log", this=0x2236f60) at /usr/include/c++/5/fstream:802
#7  std::basic_ofstream<char, std::char_traits<char> >::basic_ofstream (__mode=std::_S_out, __s=0x223c220 "/home/scpeters/.gazebo/test-11345/test.log", this=0x2236f60, __in_chrg=<optimized out>, __vtt_parm=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/c++/5/fstream:702
#8  gazebo::common::FileLogger::Init (this=0x7f14ceaaf680 <gazebo::common::Console::log>, _prefix="test-", _filename="test.log") at /data_fast/scpeters/ws/gazebo7/src/gazebo/gazebo/common/Console.cc:205
#9  0x0000000000445b2a in gazebo::ServerFixture::ServerFixture (this=0x2221b70) at /data_fast/scpeters/ws/gazebo7/src/gazebo/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.cc:91
#10 0x000000000041955b in GPURaySensorTest::GPURaySensorTest (this=0x2221b70) at /data_fast/scpeters/ws/gazebo7/src/gazebo/test/integration/gpu_laser.cc:25
#11 GPURaySensorTest_NameCollision_Test::GPURaySensorTest_NameCollision_Test (this=0x2221b70) at /data_fast/scpeters/ws/gazebo7/src/gazebo/test/integration/gpu_laser.cc:213
...
~~~

It's hard to see how it could be related, but I checked my collection of backtraces from overnight testing, and this looks new. I saw a [random stackoverflow post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/40498613/logger-receiving-segmentation-fault-when-trying-to-open-ofstream) saying they had a similar issue with an ofstream, but who knows. Since this looks like a new flaky failure, I'd like to try to fix it before merging.

It's hard to see how it could be related, but I checked my collection of backtraces from overnight testing, and this looks new. I saw a random stackoverflow post saying they had a similar issue with an ofstream, but who knows. Since this looks like a new flaky failure, I'd like to try to fix it before merging.

content.raw:
thanks for fixing it. I'm running it in a loop to see if I can reproduce that failure in NameCollision

in the meantime, I am seeing a seg-fault after the end of `UNIT_Console_TEST`

~~~
[       OK ] Console_TEST.ColorErr (0 ms)
[----------] 13 tests from Console_TEST (4 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 13 tests from 1 test case ran. (4 ms total)

[Thread 0x7fffd7753700 (LWP 5141) exited]

Thread 1 "UNIT_Console_TE" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
std::basic_ofstream<char, std::char_traits<char> >::close (this=0x6a6ee0) at /usr/include/c++/5/fstream:803
803		  this->setstate(ios_base::failbit);
(gdb) bt

content.raw: I think  9a5c297 should do it

content.raw: yeah, that looks great!
content.html: yeah, that looks great!

content.raw: this looks fixed to me now
content.html: this looks fixed to me now

content.raw: It looks good to me visually, but I haven't fully reviewed the code
content.html: It looks good to me visually, but I haven't fully reviewed the code

content.raw: These changes could also be ported to ign-common.
content.html: These changes could also be ported to ign-common.

content.raw: I assume Ogre is handling these exceptions?
content.html: I assume Ogre is handling these exceptions?

content.raw: we're catching the exceptions [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/dce3030d87304270475ddb742e9be402bc383b5c/gazebo/rendering/RTShaderSystem.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#RTShaderSystem.cc-246)
content.html: we're catching the exceptions here

content.raw: I see some older code on this branch also refers to `OGRE_VERSION_MINOR == 6`. I'm wondering if this should be `<= 7`. What Ogre versions does Gazebo 7 support?
content.html: I see some older code on this branch also refers to OGRE_VERSION_MINOR == 6. I'm wondering if this should be <= 7. What Ogre versions does Gazebo 7 support?

content.raw: I don't think we support 1.6 anymore since min ogre version in trusty in 1.7. Also, RTShaderSystem is introduced in 1.7 and API changed in 1.8 so we only check 1.7 here.
content.html: I don't think we support 1.6 anymore since min ogre version in trusty in 1.7. Also, RTShaderSystem is introduced in 1.7 and API changed in 1.8 so we only check 1.7 here.

content.raw: Got it, thanks
content.html: Got it, thanks

content.raw: Remove comment? There are quite a few others along the code, not sure if we want to keep them for future debugging
content.html: Remove comment? There are quite a few others along the code, not sure if we want to keep them for future debugging

content.raw: I removed most of them but left a few to highlight key changes compared to original OGRE files. 41206ba
content.html: I removed most of them but left a few to highlight key changes compared to original OGRE files. 41206ba

content.raw: Use `override`?
content.html: Use override?

content.raw: added a few `override`s. 41206ba
content.html: added a few overrides. 41206ba

content.raw: Do you envision this changing much in the future? Is it worth it to pimpl?
content.html: Do you envision this changing much in the future? Is it worth it to pimpl?

content.raw: I don't expect to touch this class much in the future. Anyhow, I removed the `mLanguage` variable. 23c6227
content.html: I don't expect to touch this class much in the future. Anyhow, I removed the mLanguage variable. 23c6227

content.raw: Move it below public functions?
content.html: Move it below public functions?

content.raw: done. 41206ba
content.html: done. 41206ba

content.raw: Maybe want to add an OSRF copyright notice now that we're editing it
content.html: Maybe want to add an OSRF copyright notice now that we're editing it

content.raw: added. 5aac216
content.html: added. 5aac216

content.raw: I know this is an improvement, but I'd just like to point out that the darker shadows might mess up user results.
content.html: I know this is an improvement, but I'd just like to point out that the darker shadows might mess up user results.

content.raw: it was initially requested to set the shadow ambient factor to 0 (range [0-1]) down from 0.4. I took a compromise and set to 0.2. We can decide to keep 0.4 in this version and change to 0.2 later in `default` if we want to reduce the impact of the shadow changes on user code?
content.html: it was initially requested to set the shadow ambient factor to 0 (range [0-1]) down from 0.4. I took a compromise and set to 0.2. We can decide to keep 0.4 in this version and change to 0.2 later in default if we want to reduce the impact of the shadow changes on user code?

content.raw: Up to you. I don't have a strong opinion about this, since the possibility of breaking user code is mostly speculative.
content.html: Up to you. I don't have a strong opinion about this, since the possibility of breaking user code is mostly speculative.

content.raw: ok I'll keep these changes. Added a note in migration guide. fb7f174
content.html: ok I'll keep these changes. Added a note in migration guide. fb7f174

content.html: started new CI builds
